programme.title: UFC Fight Night
programme.desc: Kamaru Usman (20-4) goes up against Joaquin Buckley (21-6) in the welterweight main event; Rose Namajunas (14-7) faces Miranda Maverick (17-5) in the flyweight co-main event; Edmen Shahbazyan (14-5) vs. Andre Petroski (13-4) in a middleweight bout.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA College World Series
programme.desc: Arizona dropped its opening game to Coastal Carolina, 7-4, despite two RBIs from Maddox Mihalakis; Louisville scored two runs in the ninth but gave up a walk-off RBI double to Gavin Turley in the bottom of the inning to lose to Oregon State, 4-3.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: An in-depth newsmagazine featuring a talented pool of reporters and producers from ESPN, presenting profiles of well-known athletes and coaches as well as investigative reports and cutting-edge stories on emerging and established sports.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: A preview of the upcoming Major League Baseball game with expert analysis, insightful observations and exclusive interviews; coverage includes highlights of Major League Baseball games and the latest baseball news with knowledgeable commentary.

programme.title: ESPN Films
programme.desc: The most remarkable sports stories are featured, as storytellers break away from the traditional view of a sports film and showcasing stories of passion, triumph, loss and resurgence of athletes, as featured guests share their side of the story.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Kyle Harrison (1-1, 4.56) held Colorado to three runs in five innings of work in a no-decision on June 10; Dustin May (3-4, 4.46) is 2-1 with a 2.97 ERA in six home starts this season after holding the Mets to two runs in six innings on June 2.

programme.title: 2025 NBA Finals
programme.desc: Oklahoma City evened the series at two games apiece with a 111-104 win over Indiana in Game 4 behind 35 points from Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and 27 from Jalen Williams; Pascal Siakam led the Pacers with 20 points and eight rebounds in the loss.

programme.title: 2025 NCAA College World Series
programme.desc: No. 13 seed Coastal Carolina defeated Arizona in the opener, 7-4, behind a three-run eighth inning, led by Sebastian Alexander and Blake Barthol; No. 8 seed Oregon State beat Louisville, 4-3, behind a walk-off RBI double from Gavin Turley.

programme.title: College Track & Field
programme.desc: The NCAA's outdoor track & field season culminates with the 2025 Men's and Women's Division I Championships at Hayward Field in Eugene, Oregon, from June 11 to 14; Men's and Women's events alternate days starting with Men's Day 1.

programme.title: The Ultimate Fighter
programme.desc: Two of the more prestigious names in the UFC coach their teams of up-and-coming fighters, who are in search of a UFC contract for winning the season, as they compete against each other in the Octagon and in challenges outside of the bouts.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Brett Morgen takes a look back at June 17th, 1994, one of the most memorable days in sports that saw a variety of different events, including O.J. Simpson's low-speed chase, the opening of the FIFA World Cup, and Arnold Palmer's final round.

programme.title: The Last Dance
programme.desc: In what management insists is Phil Jackson's final season in Chicago as head coach of the Bulls, he continues to seem like the only one who can steer this unique, singular collection of talent to another title throughout the 1990s.

programme.title: Greenland
programme.desc: The docuseries showcases some of the most exotic and hidden soccer fields from around the world, showcasing how the field provides the locals an opportunity to grow the sport and the unique sights and surroundings that make the field stand out.

programme.desc: The docuseries showcases some of the most exotic and hidden soccer fields from around the world, showcasing how the field provides the locals an opportunity to grow the sport and the unique sights and surroundings that make the field stand out.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Vancouver Canucks were one win from becoming the first Canadian team to win a Stanley Cup title since 1993, but a loss to the Chicago Blackhawks in Game 7 of the 2011 Stanley Cup Final caused unrest among the home fans, leading to a massive riot.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: Rivalries come to be for various reasons, but a hit by Claude Lemieux of the Colorado Avalanche on Kris Draper of the Detroit Red Wings in the late 1990s would ignite a rivalry in the NHL that would stand the test of time between the two teams.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: The story of the 1985 Mississippi State Bulldogs team and how they failed to win the College World Series is retold, including the complicated relationship between Will Clark and Rafael Palmeiro and an exploration of what the players accomplished.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers beat Philadelphia in the NBA Finals in 1980, 1982 and 1983, while Boston won the crown by beating Houston in 1981; Los Angeles and Boston staged the first of three epic battles in 1984, and the rivalry transformed fans' view of the game.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1978, the Celtics drafted Larry Bird, but he played his final year at Indiana State before signing; Los Angeles selected Magic Johnson No. 1 in 1979 after he led Michigan State to a victory over Bird and the Sycamores in the NCAA title game.

programme.title: SEC Storied
programme.desc: Former LSU track and field star Lolo Jones chronicles her athletic career as she discusses her three NCAA titles and her inclusion on the 2008 U.S. Olympic Team that ended with her tripping on the final hurdle in the 100 meter hurdles.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: The top 10 one-round wars in UFC history are examined, showcasing how these bouts made for thrilling brawls within the Octagon, becoming instant classics and includes bouts from top fighters such as, Chuck Liddel and Cain Velasquez.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: The hosts do a top 10 countdown as they take an in-depth look at many of the greatest moments in the history of the Ultimate Fighting Championship, and examine the most brutal knockouts, stunning upsets and devastating brawls.

programme.title: Formula 1
programme.desc: Oscar Piastri increased his lead over Lando Norris to 10 points after a dominant win at Spain over Norris, while four-time defending champion Max Verstappen sits in third; Verstappen won the last three races at Canada after beating Norris last year.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: World Surf League
programme.desc: The number one stop on the World Surf League Challenger Series showcases some of the world's top surfers battling out for a qualifying position on the 2025 Championship Tour; Australia's India Robinson and Brazil's Samuel Pupo won here in 2023.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: Hockey Miscellaneous
programme.desc: Joe Sakic had been with the Colorado Avalanche since the team relocated from Quebec, even earning captaincy, but when the New York Rangers offered a tough-to-match contract in 1997, the Avalanche went to an unlikely source to keep him.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: Analysts cover the latest around the world of the NHL, featuring highlights from recent games, previews of upcoming marquee matchups, the newest stories making headlines and all-access footage to give viewers a unique look at their favorite players.

programme.title: Always College Football
programme.desc: ESPN analyst Greg McElroy breaks down the biggest headlines throughout college football, discussing the latest results and the impact they will have on the CFP, previewing upcoming matchups and interviews with top names on and off the field.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: NHRA in 30
programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: CONCACAF Gold Cup Soccer
programme.desc: Mexico is coming off of a 1-0 victory against Türkiye in a preparation match on June 10 where Orbelín Pineda found the net; the Dominican Republic claimed a 5-0 win over Dominica in a World Cup qualifier, led by Peter González's goal and 2 assists.

programme.title: CONCACAF Gold Cup Soccer
programme.desc: Mexico is coming off of a 1-0 victory against Türkiye in a preparation match on June 10 where Orbelín Pineda found the net; the Dominican Republic claimed a 5-0 win over Dominica in a World Cup qualifier, led by Peter González's goal and 2 assists.

programme.title: DIRT II: A Season With High Limit
America's Day at the Races
programme.desc: Nationwide coverage of thoroughbred racing from venues around the country, showcasing major stakes races with in-depth analysis from expert handicappers; coverage includes the latest horse racing news, exclusive interviews and insightful commentary.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Ryan Bergert (1-0, 1.26) shut out Milwaukee on only one hit in 5.1 innings on June 8; Zac Gallen (4-8, 5.15) lost three of his last four starts after giving up four runs on six hits, including three home runs, in 6.2 innings vs. Cincinnati on June 8.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: The seventh stop of 2025, as competitors look for the lake's largemouth, smallmouth and spotted bass; the Elites last competed on Tenkiller in 2019, as Carl Jocumsen won that regular-season finale to become the first Australian Bassmaster champion.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Dennis Hauger increased his lead over fellow rookie Lochie Hughes to 38 points after winning at Detroit over Caio Collet for his fourth win in the first five races; Louis Foster won the race at Gateway last year en route to the 2024 title.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Dennis Hauger increased his lead over fellow rookie Lochie Hughes to 38 points after winning at Detroit over Caio Collet for his fourth win in the first five races; Louis Foster won the race at Gateway last year en route to the 2024 title.

programme.title: CONCACAF Gold Cup Match Day
programme.desc: A thorough preview of the upcoming CONCACAF Gold Cup matches, including in-depth analysis of strategy, exclusive interviews, predictions from experts, special features and a breakdown of each team's strengths and weaknesses entering the game.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: Carlos Rodon (8-4, 2.87) had his four-start winning streak snapped by Boston on June 8, allowing five runs over five innings; Hunter Dobbins (3-1, 4.20) picked up the win in that same game, holding the Yankees to three runs over five innings.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Practice
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the race at Gateway; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: CONCACAF Gold Cup Match Day
programme.desc: A thorough preview of the upcoming CONCACAF Gold Cup matches, including in-depth analysis of strategy, exclusive interviews, predictions from experts, special features and a breakdown of each team's strengths and weaknesses entering the game.

programme.title: Indycar INXT Racing
programme.desc: Rookie Dennis Hauger increased his lead over fellow rookie Lochie Hughes to 38 points after winning at Detroit over Caio Collet for his fourth win in the first five races; Louis Foster won the race at Gateway last year en route to the 2024 title.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, incisive and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Racing
programme.desc: Kyle Kirkwood secured his second win of the season with a dominant victory at Detroit over Santino Ferrucci, while two-time defending champion Alex Palou leads Pato O'Ward by 90 points; Josef Newgarden won four of the last five races at Gateway.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Gold Cup
programme.desc: Panama comes off of a 3-0 victory against Nicaragua in a World Cup qualifier, led by a goal and assist from Éric Davis; Guadeloupe claimed a 2-0 aggregate win over Nicaragua to qualify for the Gold Cup after the second leg ended, 1-0.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: CONCACAF Gold Cup Soccer
programme.desc: Costa Rica and Suriname played to a 1-1 draw in their last meeting from the Nations League group stage on Oct. 11, where Suriname's Gleofilo Vlijter equalized in the 35th minute; Josimar Alcócer had given Costa Rica the 1-0 lead in the 14th minute.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Gold Cup
programme.desc: The United States claimed a 4-2 aggregate victory against Trinidad & Tobago in the quarterifnals round of the 2023 Nations League after a 2-1 loss in the second leg; Alvin Jones found the net and provided an assist for Trinidad in the final leg.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Gold Cup
programme.desc: The United States claimed a 4-2 aggregate victory against Trinidad & Tobago in the quarterifnals round of the 2023 Nations League after a 2-1 loss in the second leg; Alvin Jones found the net and provided an assist for Trinidad in the final leg.

programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.title: CONCACAF Gold Cup Soccer
programme.desc: Haiti is coming off of a 5-1 defeat to Curacao in a World Cup qualifier on June 10, with their lone goal of the match scored by Louicius Don Deedson; Saudi Arabia suffered a 2-1 defeat to Australia in a qualifier with a goal from Abdulrahman Alobud.

programme.desc: Thorough coverage of the latest NHRA events is showcased, including detailed play-by-play, replays of the most exciting and pivotal moments from the race as well as exclusive interviews, special features, insightful commentary and highlights.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: St. Louis claimed a 3-0 victory against Los Angeles in their first meeting of the season on March 9, led by a goal and an assist from Cedric Teuchert; City goalkeeper Roman Bürki recorded 8 saves and 2 clearances for the clean sheet win.

programme.title: Australian Football League
programme.desc: Port Adelaide (5-7-0) has won three of the four previous meetings with Melbourne (5-8-0), including a 53-51 triumph last season in Round 22, as Jason Horne-Francis had nine possessions in the final term to finish with 27 disposals and two goals.

programme.title: STIHL Timbersports Series
programme.desc: Competitive lumberjacks oppose each other in various disciplines based on traditional logging skills in an effort to determine the best all-around lumberjack; Hot Saw, Single Buck, Springboard Chop, Standing Block Chop, Stock Saw and Underhand Chop.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Qualifications
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers aim for the best starting spot in the upcoming race, and the driver with the fastest time is awarded pole position; Scott McLaughlin averaged 179.972 mph to win the pole at Gateway last year before finishing the race in second.

programme.title: ARCA Racing
programme.desc: Brenden Queen secured his third win of the season and second in the last three races with his victory at Michigan over Corey Heim to lead Lavar Scott by six points; William Sawalich won the last two races at Berlin after beating Scott last year.

programme.title: Indycar NICS Practice
programme.desc: IndyCar drivers learn the particulars of the track and communicate to their crew how the car is handling and what adjustments need to be made in order to perform at peak efficiency during the race at Gateway; crews work to set up the car.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Gold Cup
programme.desc: Mexico is coming off of a 1-0 victory against Türkiye in a preparation match on June 10 where Orbelín Pineda found the net; the Dominican Republic claimed a 5-0 win over Dominica in a World Cup qualifier, led by Peter González's goal and 2 assists.

programme.title: Horse Racing
programme.desc: Gezora, ridden by Christophe Soumillon, holds the inside post position for the Group 1 stakes race for a one-million-euro purse, featuring a field of 12 horses running 2,100 meters on turf; D'Ores Et Deja holds the second post position.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: Forge claimed a 3-1 win over Vancouver in their last meeting from the 2024 season on Sept. 21, led by a goal and assist from David Choiniere; Beni Badibanga and Noah Jensen closed out the scoring for Forge before TJ Tahid found the net for Vancouver.

programme.title: Canadian Premier League Soccer
programme.desc: Atlético Ottawa claimed a 5-2 victory against Valour in their first meeting of the season on May 10 behind a 4-goal performance from Samuel Salter in 58 minutes; David Rodriguez found the net with Atlético's third goal of the win.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: The seventh stop of 2025, as competitors look for the lake's largemouth, smallmouth and spotted bass; the Elites last competed on Tenkiller in 2019, as Carl Jocumsen won that regular-season finale to become the first Australian Bassmaster champion.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: The highest level of professional bass fishing features pro anglers competing all season for the opportunity to win points toward the Progressive Bassmaster Angler of the Year award and to qualify for the Bassmaster Classic.

programme.desc: Over $3 million in prize money is awarded, including a $1 million bonus for the winner of the championship round, as 15 athletes compete in each of the eight rodeo disciplines compete against the top 5 ranked athletes in their events.

programme.title: Magnify
programme.desc: Tyquone Greer and Marquise Pryor lead Orr Academy basketball into the upcoming season under head coach Lou Adams, as the team deals with the inequities and troubling surrounding of Chicago as they strive for a championship and collegiate dreams.

programme.title: Magnify
programme.desc: The documentary chronicles the lives of incarcerated basketball players at San Quentin State Prison and explores inmates' personal struggles as they search for redemption and transcendence both on and off the court.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: Motoamerica King of the Baggers Rewind
Playing Lessons
programme.desc: Multiple-time PGA TOUR winner Max Homa joins Bones on the course and shares his tips and strategies that have led to his global success. Max gives in-depth advice for how to focus off the tee and limit misses, as well as his green reading process.

programme.title: LPGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: Lilia Vu returned from a back injury and spoiled Lexi Thompson's bid for her first win in five years after finishing at 16-under before defeating Thompson and Grace Kim in a playoff to capture the title in last year's edition of the tournament.

programme.title: LPGA Tour Golf
programme.desc: The tournament, which features a $3 million purse, celebrates its 11th edition in 2025; Lilia Vu defeated Grace Kim and Lexi Thompson on a three-hole playoff in last year's edition; South Korea's Mirim Lee won the inaugural edition in 2014.
